We welcome Mr. Luke Wayne as our new Assistant Principal at Riverton High School! Mr. Wayne was raised in Jacksonville, IL. After graduating from Jacksonville High School in 2002, he attended the University of Illinois (Champaign-Urbana), where he earned a B.A. in History. Immediately after college, he joined Teach for America as a High School Special Education teacher in Las Vegas, NV. An avid learner, Luke, also earned a M.A. Ed in Special Education (UNLV) and a M.A. Ed. in Principalship (University of Northern Iowa). After three years in Las Vegas, Luke merged his love of education and travel in a position, teaching at the American School of Milan (Italy). He has spent the past seven years as a teacher, then administrator, at the American School of Bombay (India). In his free time, Mr. Wayne enjoys reading, SCUBA diving, biking, and spending time outdoors with his lovely wife (Jennifer) and four-year-old daughter (Charlie). He is delighted to bring both his family and a wide range of experiences in education back to Central Illinois. #hawkup #hawkpride

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTION

Are we doing parent/teacher conferences like has been discussed before school starts?

Parent-Teacher Conferences will be scheduled before the first day of student attendance on Thursday, August 13 and Friday, August 14 for ALL three schools. Scheduling will be set up through Skyward. Parents will have the option of an in-person conference or a virtual conference. At these meetings, we encourage students to attend along with parents to meet teachers and get set up for success through all phases of learning this school year. This will be an opportunity to gain clarification on what in-person learning will look like in the classroom and to gain knowledge on how to navigate remote learning, should we need to move back to that. This will also serve as a meet your teacher opportunity, as we will not be able to do this in our traditional format. We encourage students and parents at all three buildings to attend. Please be on the lookout in the next week for information on signing up for this.

We will be postponing the Riverton High School graduation ceremony indefinitely, and canceling the Riverton Middle School promotion ceremony. Additional guidance will be coming soon from Mrs. Doerfler on how we will honor our 8th Grade Hawks, and we will communicate our plans and a date for the postponed high school graduation following further guidance from the IDPH and ISBE. Please read the linked letter for additional details.

A tentative rescheduled graduation date is June 6th. This is subject to change based on guidance from the Illinois State Board of Education and Governor Pritzker.
